author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Central Crime Branch on Saturday arrested three persons for allegedly forging a land document to sell it to two persons.

R. Mayilsamy (63), a businessman of Kalangal Road in Sulur, had bought 33 cents on the Sulur Road from P. Nirmala (41), of Sulur, in 2006.

In 2011 Nirmala allegedly forged the documents and gave the power of attorney for the same to R. Ramakrishnan (52) of Tirupur, who later sold it to his brother-in-law P. Arumugam (53).

Arumugam pledged the documents at a private bank on the Rangai Gowder Street, in Coimbatore, and obtained a loan for Rs. 1.95 crore.

Mayilsamy came to know that he has been cheated.

Nirmala, Ramakrishnan, and Arumugam were booked under sections 120B (criminal conspiracy), 467 (forgery of valuable security or will), 468 (forgery for the purpose of cheating), 471 (using as genuine a forged document or an electronic record) and 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property), of the Indian Penal Code.

They were produced before the Judicial Magistrate-I in Coimbatore and has been remanded in judicial custody. The police were inquiring whether bank staff colluded with Arumugam in pledging the forged documents.
title: Forgery: three arrested
